# Importando os dados

Importação através da função `gsheet2tbl` do pacote  **gsheet**.

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_a1e40e6ce7bd60ee486e6f31e1914802'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
sev <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1D_tSkv6calLSIxxzwG_qiMH3cBlG1Y0B/edit#gid=238991737")
```
:::


# Vizualização gráfica


::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_b337c1d0f10d37480ba6e45e6b39dd46'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggthemes)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_0f8fbfbf9e9845203f6248516b28462c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sev_med <- sev|>
  group_by(Tratamentos, DAE) |> 
  summarise(Sev_media = mean(Sev), DAE = DAE)

sev_med |> 
  ggplot(aes(DAE, Sev_media, color = Tratamentos))+
  geom_point(color = "black")+
  geom_line()+
  theme_few()+
  labs(x = "Dias", y = "Severidade", title = "Progresso da Ferrugem asiática da Soja")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Ferrugem_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Área abaixo da cruva de progresso da doença (AACPD)

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_19fea47bfd2f439b7fc884a9b8314a88'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(epifitter)

sev_curve <- sev |> 
  group_by(Tratamentos, Blocos) |> 
  summarise(AACPD = AUDPC(DAE, Sev))
```
:::


## Análise estatística

Realizando a análise de variância (ANOVA) em para dados de experimentos delineados em blocos ao acaso (DBC)

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_c5c2c7bc204600c983b944c020fcff87'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_aacpd <- aov(AACPD ~ Tratamentos + Blocos, data = sev_curve)

anova(aov_aacpd)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: AACPD
            Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
Tratamentos  3 1790871  596957 136.228 5.588e-09 ***
Blocos       1   18944   18944   4.323   0.06178 .  
Residuals   11   48203    4382                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::

### Checando as premissas: 

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_9479939df99b79fc5ceab8bd6f43496b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(aov_aacpd$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  aov_aacpd$residuals
W = 0.96068, p-value = 0.6741
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_f27de8fd479a694665e6bede7bb5f367'}

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(AACPD ~ Tratamentos, data = sev_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  AACPD by Tratamentos
Bartlett's K-squared = 28.239, df = 3, p-value = 3.235e-06
```
:::
:::

Pelo teste de Bartlett os dados não apresentam homogeneidade de variância. Vamos refazer os testes através das funções 'check_normality' e 'check_heteroscedasticity' do pacote **performance** que também pode ser utilizado.


::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_2a07764831d1939bd735275a57747293'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_normality(aov_aacpd)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.611).
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_f10f482559dcc02493cf95e2134856e0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_aacpd)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p = 0.032).
```
:::
:::

Os resultados se mantêm, havendo necessidade de transformação dos dados.

## Transformação por boxcox

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_1ba51b9d7e78f2b6485b3c2aed5ea01f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(MASS)

b <- boxcox(lm(sev_curve$AACPD+0.1 ~ 1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Ferrugem_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda <- b$x[which.max(b$y)]

sev_curve$AACPD_2 <- (sev_curve$AACPD ^ lambda - 1) / lambda
```
:::


## ANOVA com os dados transformados

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_90cfda0b324641de573db1011c2b2b52'}

```{.r .cell-code}
aov_aacpd_2 <- aov(AACPD_2 ~ Tratamentos + Blocos, data = sev_curve)

anova(aov_aacpd_2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: AACPD_2
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
Tratamentos  3 59.058 19.6858 324.447 5.174e-11 ***
Blocos       1  0.019  0.0193   0.318    0.5841    
Residuals   11  0.667  0.0607                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


### Checando as premissas novamente

Via testes: 

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_7c1609cae21b43a2b1b05a37238588be'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(aov_aacpd_2$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  aov_aacpd_2$residuals
W = 0.96036, p-value = 0.6683
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_dc554bf49873aca966454947a2f662b2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(AACPD_2 ~ Tratamentos, data = sev_curve)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  AACPD_2 by Tratamentos
Bartlett's K-squared = 5.482, df = 3, p-value = 0.1397
```
:::
:::


Via performance:

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_1960b7e54976eeaeea63fcb094959700'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(aov_aacpd_2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.497).
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_db72713f314cff7dfd2c489913c0fb83'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(aov_aacpd_2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.081).
```
:::
:::

### Testes de comparação de médias


::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_59f7659a65a2992cdfa81d5c36deb7a6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)

medias_sev <- emmeans(aov_aacpd_2, ~ Tratamentos)

medias_sev
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 Tratamentos   emmean    SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Controle        7.13 0.123 11     6.86     7.40
 F + Produto     2.90 0.123 11     2.63     3.17
 Fungicida (F)   3.29 0.123 11     3.02     3.56
 Produto         6.70 0.123 11     6.43     6.97

Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_9f05d84b07b4cb9d8fb0487e1fff1aba'}

```{.r .cell-code}
pwpm(medias_sev)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
              Controle F + Produto Fungicida (F) Produto
Controle        [7.13]      <.0001        <.0001  0.1141
F + Produto      4.235      [2.90]        0.1656  <.0001
Fungicida (F)    3.841      -0.395        [3.29]  <.0001
Produto          0.436      -3.799        -3.404  [6.70]

Row and column labels: Tratamentos
Upper triangle: P values   adjust = "tukey"
Diagonal: [Estimates] (emmean) 
Lower triangle: Comparisons (estimate)   earlier vs. later
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Ferrugem_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_1d375854ab598b7e551cc603b62c15ea'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(multcomp)

cld(medias_sev, Letters = letters)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 Tratamentos   emmean    SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 F + Produto     2.90 0.123 11     2.63     3.17  a    
 Fungicida (F)   3.29 0.123 11     3.02     3.56  a    
 Produto         6.70 0.123 11     6.43     6.97   b   
 Controle        7.13 0.123 11     6.86     7.40   b   

Confidence level used: 0.95 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 4 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::

Os tratamentos são agrupados em letras ('a' e 'b'). Tratamentos que compartilham a mesma letra não são significativamente diferentes entre si.

F + Produto e Fungicida (F) estão no grupo 'a'.
Produto e Controle estão no grupo 'b'.
